meanings.definition: Either of the first pair of appendages near the mouth of an arachnid, typically modified as pincers or fangs.
meanings.sent1: The chelicera of the spider helps it catch prey.
meanings.sent2: Arachnids use their chelicera to grasp and hold onto their food.
meanings.sent3: The spider accidentally pinched itself with its chelicera while trying to eat.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the sharp chelicera of a spider, never letting go of her goals.
meanings.sent5: The shiny chelicera of the scorpion gleamed in the sunlight, ready to strike.

meanings.definition: The corresponding pair of mouthparts in certain other arthropods.
meanings.sent1: The chelicera of the crab helps it break open shells.
meanings.sent2: Certain arthropods use their chelicera to crush their food.
meanings.sent3: The beetle comically tried to eat with its chelicera but ended up making a mess.
meanings.sent4: His words were as sharp and biting as the chelicera of an insect.
meanings.sent5: The powerful chelicera of the ant symbolized its strength and determination.
